channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'Unacceptable to the badge' - Dyche fumes at FA Cup exit
item.description: Sean Dyche calls for some of his Nottingham Forest players to "have a look in the mirror" after an "unacceptable" first-half performance in their FA Cup loss at Wrexham on penalties.

item.title: Wrexham's story 'written in the stars, literally'
item.description: Wrexham's remarkable rise continues by knocking Premier League side Nottingham Forest out of the FA Cup in dramatic fashion.

item.title: Solskjaer set for face-to-face talks with Man Utd chiefs
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is set for face-to-face talks with Manchester United chiefs about becoming the club's interim boss.

item.title: How to follow the FA Cup on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the FA Cup third round on TV and radio this weekend.

item.title: Macclesfield's 'massive occasion' tinged with sadness
item.description: Non-league Macclesfield host holders Crystal Palace in the FA Cup on Saturday, 25 days after the death of their player Ethan McLeod.

item.title: Wrexham shock Forest in shootout after six-goal thriller
item.description: Watch highlights as Wrexham shock Nottingham Forest in an FA Cup third-round thriller, beating the Premier League side on penalties after a 3-3 draw.

item.title: Oxford beat MK Dons in FA Cup penalty shootout
item.description: New Oxford United boss Matt Bloomfield watches on from the stands as his side beat MK Dons on penalties to progress to the FA Cup fourth round.

item.title: Chelsea tie 'not an autograph session' for Charlton
item.description: Boss Nathan Jones says Charlton need to make sure their FA Cup third round tie against Chelsea does not turn into an "autograph session".

item.title: Young Chelsea can be new Class of '92 - Rosenior
item.description: Chelsea's young squad has the potential to grow and deliver trophies like Manchester United's famous Class of '92 side, new boss Liam Rosenior believes.

item.title: Fans accuse Spurs of 'dramatic fall in ambition'
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur's main supporters' group has accused the club of a "dramatic fall in ambition" after meeting with senior club figures to discuss this campaign.

item.title: Chukwuemeka secures stoppage-time point for Dortmund against Frankfurt
item.description: Carney Chukwuemeka scores the second of two stoppage-time goals to bring Borussia Dortmund level with Eintracht Frankfurt, in a thrilling six-goal Bundesliga game.

item.title: Wigan survive late scare to beat Preston in Lancashire derby
item.description: Harrison Bettoni's lone goal seals a narrow victory for League One side Wigan Athletic, as Brad Potts' injury time equaliser for Preston North End is ruled out for offside.

item.title: Shipley goal helps Port Vale past Fleetwood
item.description: Jordan Shipley scores the only goal to put Port Vale into the fourth round of the FA Cup at the expense of Fleetwood Town.

item.title: Watch every penalty from Wrexham's FA Cup win over Forest
item.description: Watch every penalty as Wrexham knocked out Premier League Nottingham Forest after a 3-3 draw in the third round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Watch Saka's best Premier League goals
item.description: Watch a selection of Bukayo Saka's best Premier League goals, as the winger agrees a new contract with Arsenal.

item.title: Why Man City have signed 'extraordinary' Semenyo
item.description: Antoine Semenyo has gone from Bristol City to Man City in the space of three years. BBC Sport looks at why Pep Guardiola has moved for the Bournemouth man.

item.title: Saka agrees new long-term contract with Arsenal
item.description: Bukayo Saka agrees a new long-term contract with Arsenal.

item.title: New players, new managers - what to look out for in WSL after winter break
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the key talking points as the Women's Super League returns after a four-week winter break.

item.title: Sutton's FA Cup third-round predictions v DJ and producer Shadow Child
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ and producer Shadow Child - and AI - with his predictions for all 32 FA Cup third-round ties.

item.title: Arsenal monitoring Livramento - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Arsenal monitoring Tino Livramento as a potential summer signing, Aston Villa exploring a deal for Conor Gallagher, Dominik Szoboszlai close to agreeing contract extension at Liverpool, plus more.

item.title: Macclesfield's turbulent, triumphant journey
item.description: Sarah Mulkerrins tells the tale of Macclesfield FC, a club that reformed in 2020 after Macclesfield Town were wound up in the High Court.

item.title: I've worked so hard for this opportunity - Rosenior
item.description: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior says he has "worked so hard my whole life for this opportunity" in his first news conference as Blues boss.

item.title: The best years are to come - Guardiola on signing 'extraordinary' Semenyo
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola discusses the signing of "extraordinary" Ghana forward Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth after his £65m release clause was met.

item.title: Henderson's stunning double as Ross County beat Thistle
item.description: Jay Henderson scores within 18 seconds and adds a second within 10 minutes as bottom side Ross County mark Stuart Kettlewell's return as manager with a victory over second-top Partick Thistle in the Scottish Championship.

item.title: 'Hugely disappointing' - Moyes on Keane red card appeal rejection
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes says the decision to reject their appeal against defender Michael Keane's red card is "hugely disappointing"'.

item.title: Spurs captain Romero given additional ban after red card
item.description: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero is given an additional one-match suspension and fined £50,000 for his behaviour during his side's Premier League defeat to Liverpool last month.

item.title: Man admits racist abuse of England's Carter
item.description: Nigel Dewale made derogatory comments about the Lioness star's skin colour.

item.title: Ex-Chelsea employee spared jail after £200k fraud
item.description: Walsh had been creating false refunds for tickets that had not been put onto the exchange site.

item.title: Frank reaches crisis point at Spurs - was he doomed from the start?
item.description: Head coach Thomas Frank has reached crisis point at Spurs - but is he solely to blame and has he been doomed from the start, asks Phil McNulty?

item.title: 'If you're outside the top six, you can never target an FA Cup run'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why the FA Cup has fallen down the pecking order for managers, despite still being a special competition.

item.title: Everton 'surprised' after Keane red card upheld
item.description: Everton say they are "surprised and disappointed" after their appeal against Michael Keane's red card against Wolves is rejected.

item.title: Rosenior will ignore 'noise' after Chelsea appointment
item.description: Liam Rosenior says he will be his own man and ignore the "noise" around his appointment as Chelsea manager.

item.title: 'Won't let anyone knock him' - how Miley silenced critics
item.description: Lewis Miley previously came under fire from a minority of social media users but has "showed his class" to silence his critics.

item.title: Fifa criticised for silence on World Cup tickets for disabled
item.description: Fifa's failure to address concerns over tickets for disabled supporters at the World Cup is "unacceptable", a charity has said.

item.title: Chelsea charged after bottle thrown following Villa loss
item.description: The Football Association (FA) charges Chelsea after a bottle is thrown towards Aston Villa's bench in December.

item.title: 'My best is yet to come' - Semenyo joins Man City in £65m deal
item.description: Manchester City sign Ghana international Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth in a deal worth about £65m.

item.title: Rangers & Motherwell have tickets cut for pyro use
item.description: Rangers and Motherwell have their away allocations cut by 50 tickets for one match for repeated breaches of SPFL rules regarding pyrotechnics, while Aberdeen and Hibs are issued with suspended penalties.

item.title: Salford & Accrington games among four frozen off
item.description: Oldham Athletic, Chesterfield, Salford City and Accrington Stanley matches scheduled to take place on Saturday are postponed due to freezing conditions.

item.title: 'We have so much to thank Terry for' - Bellamy
item.description: Wales head coach Craig Bellamy describes Terry Yorath's impact on Welsh football as "immeasurable" as tributes are paid to the late ex-Wales boss.

item.title: What can we expect from Rita Guarino's West Ham?
item.description: West Ham are embarking on a new journey with Italian manager Rita Guarino - but what are her plans for the club?

item.title: MOTD's Logan pays tribute to 'warrior' dad Yorath
item.description: The presenter describes her dad as a "generous man" who instilled a "lifelong love of sport" in her.

item.title: Arsenal manager Slegers signs new three-year deal
item.description: Arsenal head coach Renee Slegers signs a new three-year deal with the Women's Super League club.

item.title: Can you name every FA Cup winner?
item.description: The FA Cup third round takes place this weekend - we want you to name every winner of the competition since it began in 1872.

item.title: A warrior touched by tragedy - Terry Yorath obituary
item.description: Former Wales captain and manager Terry Yorath, who has died aged 75, had a glittering career, but his life was deeply affected by two tragedies.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Relaxed' Hearts keep calm amid Old Firm noise
item.description: After a tumultuous week at Celtic and continued transfer talk at the champions and rivals Rangers, Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts appear well prepared for the second half of the season.

item.title: 'Nobody can get hold of him' - what happened to David Batty?
item.description: England midfielder David Batty vowed to have "nothing to do with the football industry" after retirement. As his former clubs Newcastle and Leeds prepare to meet, BBC Sport asks: what happened to him?

item.title: 'Appointing Nancy one of clueless Celtic's greatest blunders'
item.description: There is "no apparent big picture view at Celtic", argues BBC Sport Scotland's Tom English as Wilfried Nancy and Paul Tisdale exit the ailing champions.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: How much is the prize money for the men's and women's FA Cup?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain the prize money for the men and women's FA Cup this season.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: Is the new manager bounce real or a myth?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains whether the new manager bounce is real, or just a myth

item.title: Why is the Spanish Super Cup played in Saudi Arabia?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why the Spanish Super Cup is being played in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: How does Amorim's record compare to other Man Utd managers?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Ruben Amorim's record as a Manchester United manager and how it compares to other previous bosses

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: When does the January transfer window open and close?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team look at when the 2026 January transfer window opens.

item.title: Kyogo 'probably unlikely' to return to Celtic - O'Neill
item.description: Martin O'Neill thinks it "probably unlikely" Kyogo Furuhashi will return to Celtic from Birmingham City and does not think they "could cope" should captain Callum McGregor exit during January.

item.title: Barron adds to 'never-ending story' of Rangers injuries
item.description: Rangers midfielder Connor Barron is facing up to three months on the sidelines, with manager Danny Rohl lamenting a "never-ending story" with injury problems.

item.title: Battle at the bottom, Altena & O'Neill in focus
item.description: Livingston host Kilmarnock in a vital match at the bottom of the Scottish Premiership as Martin O'Neill returns to the Celtic dugout and Hearts new boy Jordi Altena bids to build on a promising debut.

item.title: United boss Goodwin wary of O'Neill's 'aura'
item.description: Dundee United manager Jim Goodwin is anticipating a very different Celtic test when the sides clash at Parkhead on Saturday because of the "aura" of returning manager Martin O'Neill.

item.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
item.description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

item.title: Tomori on Tuchel, living in Italy and why this is the best he has felt
item.description: Fikayo Tomori says his success at AC Milan shows English players "can go abroad and adapt to a different way of living".

item.title: AC Milan v Como league game in Australia cancelled
item.description: A Italian league match in Australia between AC Milan and Como will no longer take place following football sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation, says Serie A.

item.title: Who's leading the race for the Golden Shoe?
item.description: As the halfway mark of the 2025-26 campaign approaches, BBC Sport takes a look at the frontrunners for this season's European Golden Shoe award.

item.title: Man City finalising deal for USA midfielder Coffey
item.description: Manchester City are finalising a deal to bring in United States midfielder Sam Coffey from Portland Thorns.

item.title: Ex-Palace boss Kaminski named SK Brann head coach
item.description: Former Crystal Palace manager Laura Kaminski is named head coach of Norwegian club SK Brann.

item.title: England forward Robinson re-joins Bristol City
item.description: Bristol City women re-sign forward Katie Robinson on a two-and-a-half-year deal.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
